caseName: Thornock v. Internal Revenue Service

recap_documents.description: ORDER- The Court DENIES AS MOOT Thornock's motion for reconsideration and motion to compel acceptance. (ECF Nos. 50, 52 .) Beyond asking the Court, again, to accept and docket her April 7,2025 Amended Complaint which the Court had already done before Thornock's motion, the Court cannot identify a request for other meaningful relief among Thornock's aspersions. The Court, therefore, DENIES Thornock's motion to preserve public confidence. (ECF No. 49 .) The Court DIRECTS Thornock to comply with its provisions regarding artificial intelligence outlined in its March 17, 2025 Order if she chooses to use such technology to create her filings. The Court warns the parties that failure to comply with thisrequirement in the future may result in sanctions. SEE ORDER FOR DETAILS. Signed by District Judge John A. Gibney, Jr. on 4/10/2025. (adun, ) (Entered: 04/10/2025)
recap_documents.snippet:
Case 3:25-cv-00134-JAG          Document 54       Filed 04/10/25     Page 1 of 2 PageID# 619




                       IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
                       FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF VIRGINIA
                                       Richmond Division


REBECCA THORNOCK,
               Plaintiff,

V.                                                          Civil Action No. 3:25cvl34


INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, et ai.
                      Defendants.

recap_documents.description: ORDER- The Court DENIES Thornocks motion for reconsideration. (ECF No. 66 .) Moving forward, the Court will only consider filings drafted by a licensed attorney or filings drafted by Rebecca Thornock herself, with the help of artificial intelligence if she so chooses. subject to the requirements set forth in the Courts March 17, 2025 Order, (see ECF No. 24, at 2). Further, if Thornock appears before the Court at any hearing, she must appear at counsels table either by herself or with retained counsel who is admitted to practice before this Court. The Court WARNS Thornock that failure to comply with this Order may result in sanctions. SEE ORDER FOR DETAILS. Signed by District Judge John A. Gibney, Jr. on 4/16/2025. Copy mailed to Plaintiff. (adun, ) (Entered: 04/16/2025)

ORDER that the Court GRANTS a preliminary injunction, (ECF No. 2 ), and DIRECTS the IRS to reinstate Thornock to her position, effective Tuesday, March 18, 2025, at 10:00 a.m. Additionally, for the reasons stated from the bench, the Court GRANTS Thornock's motion to recognize delayed filing due to court closure, (ECF No. 5 ); DENIES AS MOOT Thornock's motion to accept Temporary Retraining Order as filed on February 19, 2025, (ECF No. 4 ): DENIES Thornock's motion to reconsider the retaliation claim, (ECF No. 12 ); GRANTS Thornock's motion to supplement the record regarding ongoing retaliation, (ECF No. 16 ); DENIES Thornock's motion for sanctions against defense counsel, (ECF No. 14 ); DENIES AS MOOT Thornock's motion for expedited ruling, (ECF No. 13 ); and DENIES Thornock's motion for a refund of the filing fee and request for court-covered service costs due to court delay, (ECF No. 15 ). The Court additionally DIRECTS the parties to file any motions for summary judgment on or before May 16, 2025. The Court DIRECTS Thornock to include in her motion for summary judgment, if she chooses to file one, any arguments supporting her motion to clarify that administrative exhaustion is not required, (ECF No. 6 ). The Court also SCHEDULES a bench trial in this matter for September 8, 2025, starting at 9:00 a.m. SEE ORDER FOR DETAILS. It is so ORDERED. Signed by District Judge John A. Gibney, Jr. on 3/17/2025. (jenjones, ) (Entered: 03/17/2025)
